intro: Potentilla coryphea, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in tight, rounded corymbs, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five oval-shaped leaflets, and are covered in fine hairs. Potentilla coryphea thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and subalpine habitats.
